today hot Thai Kitchen goes to Thailand for 
a special episode I'm gonna take you around

Bangkok to discover the top five noodle soups that 
you should not miss when you're in Thailand and as

the bonus we'll go and check out a dessert noodle 
soup to finish off our trip Fatiha so here we are

inside Hong law in the heart of Bangkok and we're 
on our way to check out our first noodle soup on

the list now noodle soups are known collectively 
as guay tiew and there are so many different types

today just want to show you my personal 5 
recommendations so let's start out with our

first one yet thoughtful so where we just put 
in our order and we're just waiting for it to

arrive now you might be wondering why I'm doing 
this whole thing on noodle soups and I'm doing

this because I think noodle soups is one of the 
dishes we definitely have to have while you're

in Thailand for two reasons from the standpoint of 
experiencing Thai culture noodle soups have become

a integral part of the basic Thai diet going to 
grab a bowl of quick eo4 lunches as common as

going to grab a sandwich for lunch in the western 
world and from a more practical standpoint you

should have noodle soups while you're here because 
it's not easy to replicate at home and it's not

common for Thai restaurants overseas to offer 
them plus noodle vendors here usually specialize

in one particular type of noodles so you should 
get the good stuff here while it's easy to do

so here it is re-enter poll here now the end of 
all gets its uniqueness from this pink rough I

almost love it just because it's pink and the

red sauce which gets its color from a fermented

is always served with all sorts of fish falls and 
fish cakes all these things are fish balls fish

cakes some some of them are made with shrimp 
there's always some dried squid involved I'm

not a big fan of this this is pork blood right 
here the broth is sweet and sour really nice and

well-balanced a little bit spicy the sauce the

not too much a tip for ordering the in taco is you 
can order something called get enough okay or dry

and cessful which means you get everything except

which is egg noodles with wonton and here at a

apparently when they're open will have a line

makes for really complex flavor the broth 
is pretty simple and mellow is just a really

nice pork broth but it's all this different

so well-balanced that it reminds you of comfort

you know more spicy more sour more salty 
you've got all these condiments here sweet

you can customize it according to your liking

so I'm here at a small floating market called 
the latinum what the Lincoln and we're gonna

look at our next noodle soup called gweithio 
thumb yum or thumb yam noodle soup now you

may recognize the word thumb yam as being that 
famous lemongrass soup but this is a little bit

different so this is how we feel thumb yam or 
thumb yam noodles now what makes this a thumb

yam is the fact that it's flavoured with lime

the three main characteristic of apoyo yum 
yum and it usually involves ground pork now

in here I've just got fresh pork some crispy

it's sour it's spicy it's got a really strong 
flavor but at the same time it's light who'sa

broth is a light pork bro and the nuttiness

of this dish really really well now you can 
customize and order whatever kind of noodles

you want but for this one I ordered send me or 
these little thin noodle threats right here so

we've seen a few different types of noodle soups 
so far let's take a little break and take a look

at different ways you can customize your noodles 
the way you want it there are many many things you

could do to your noodles to change it up so I'm 
going to teach you a few of those youths useful

words that you can use for when you come here to 
order them first let's take a look at different

types of noodles there are four major types of 
noodles you can choose from first is Sendai or

the biggest of all the noodles this white rice 
noodles here now we also use the word Sendai

for the chow fun noodles that I use in Pat Cu 
or pad kee Mao and things like that but that

kind is usually bigger and more sturdy because 
this is very very delicate it's very soft and

won't hold up in a stir-fry but in the noodle 
soup it's got a very kind of melt in your mouth

velvety mouth feels very nice second you've got 
CIN lick or small noodles right here is very

similar to the ones you find in the Vietnamese 
pho and it's a little bit chewier than the thin

yeah so if that's what you like you can go with 
that one and then you've got the smallest of all

noodles which is send me also rice noodles and 
send me when you eat it it's there's a lot more

going on in your mouth because you've got more 
noodles at any given point so it's kind of fun

to eat and then finally we've got Bamie which 
is the only egg noodles of these four and also

the only one that's made with wheat flour so not 
for those of you who are gluten intolerant but it

is the chilliest of all so if you like a good 
chew for your noodles you can order the meat

there are some noodles that come already spicy 
such as boat noodles or tomiyama noodles so if

your spice tolerance isn't super high you can 
tell them to tone it down a little bit Pet Noi

is what you would use to make it less spicy but 
still a little bit spicy okay my pit is for when

you want it no spicy at all finally if you want 
to take your noodles home you can use the phrase

al cup ban which means I want to take it home and 
that's all for your little noodle ordering lesson
